intro: Rhododendron ledifolium var. phoeniceum, commonly known as the Flame Azalea, is a compact shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It features showy, clustered flowers that range from red to orange, often with a yellow throat, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has dark green, leathery leaves that are elliptical in shape and provide a striking contrast to its vibrant blossoms. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. This variety is known for its ornamental value and adaptability to moist, cool climates.
